name: Idiopathic Systemic Capillary Leak Syndrome (ISCLS)
chief_complaint: Recurrent episodes of severe swelling, weakness, and low blood pressure
symptoms: Sudden edema in limbs and trunk
prognosis: Guarded; recurrent episodes can lead to organ damage or death, but long-term prophylaxis may reduce frequency
description: A rare, life-threatening condition characterized by recurrent episodes of capillary hyperpermeability leading to severe intravascular volume depletion, hemoconcentration, and shock. The pathophysiology involves unexplained systemic capillary leakage with shifts of fluid and proteins into interstitial spaces.
